dates.description: A pair of a date pattern to match, and a message to show once the current date at runtime matches the date pattern.

message.description: The message to show when the configured date pattern matches.

day_of.description: The day to match. Can be *either* a day of the week *or* a day of the month. Leaving this empty means it will match for every day.

week.description: The day of the week this pattern will match. Accepts either the full day name, like 'Tuesday', or a shortened form, like 'Tue'. Case-insensitive.

month.description: The day of the month this pattern will match. Accepts a number from 1-31.
The month to match. Accepts the full month name, like 'April', or a shortened name, like 'Apr'. Case-insensitive.

year.description: The year (in your system's default locale's year format, usually AD) to match. Accepts a positive number.

multiple_behavior.description:
This option describes what `occasion` should do when multiple configured dates match. Possible options are:
  - `first`, which shows only the first (highest) configured message
  - `last`, which shows only the last (lowest) configured message
  - `random`, which shows a random message
 - `all`, which is an object with a key `seperator` which configures the seperator between the messages.
